website_summaries.verdict: A drafting chair with a lot of adjustability and extra options not usually found on these chairs. Can be used for a variety of purposes.
pros: Movable arms offer extra support when needed
When moved in the up position, the chair is great for a number of activities
cons: Initial assembly can take some time

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could give a better review.
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Comfortable. Easy to put together. Looks nice. CONS: No way to contact seller. I recently purchased (as in a month ago recently) and the mesh is ripping off of the sides. The paint chips off the product easily, and it was scratched by the time I put it together. OVERALL: I was pretty disappointed at it's lack of sturdiness for the price. It's a good chair and works for home use, but isn't very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but doesn't hold up a year
customer_reviews.text: The back isn't staying locked in properly anymore. It randomly gives out on me after about 8 months of use. I will be sitting in it and a crack/pop type noise is heard and the back falls backwards. I'm now shopping for a new chair after less than a year with this one. The seat/bottom part is holding up great and so are the arms. I was very happy with this chair until recently.
customer_reviews.author: farkedup

customer_reviews.title: Delivered with Hole in Back Rest / No Fair Recourse
customer_reviews.text: This product good value for its price: Sturdy, comfortable, easy to assemble... BUT the item arrived with a hole in the mesh back that will grow in time. The only recourse provided is to disassemble, ship back, and then reassemble the replacement. I would not return-ship a defective item or assemble a replacement without amazon paying me for my time. Please just send me a new back rest, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: T McNZ

customer_reviews.title: After two weeks I like the chair design and functionality
customer_reviews.text: After two weeks I like the chair design and functionality. I rate it 3 stars because the SEAT is not padded enough and goes flat. I feel like I need to buy a pillow to put on the seat but shouldn't have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Walker

customer_reviews.title: Think twice. Goes bad in less than a year...
customer_reviews.text: The hydraulics in the chair will not keep the chair up. It continues to slide down and down. I contacted Amazon and they couldn't do a thing about this but I am sure they can... It was a great chair but it will go bad faster than a year's time. I only weigh 170 and it won't keep the seat up.
customer_reviews.author: Knocker

customer_reviews.title: Unfair Scrutiny of a Great Chair
customer_reviews.text: I've seen some negative reviews up top here, and wonder how people are using this chair. We use these chairs in a production environment where people sit in them every day for the past year. They have held up well, no rips or tears or seams coming apart. We do not use the tilt function much, which people are having trouble with. But we go up and down and side to side just fine. We have just ordered our third set of two. They handle daily abuse well. We like how the arms go up so they can go under tables of differing heights, or when the chair has been adjusted too high to slide under.
customer_reviews.author: donjumpsuit

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Chair
customer_reviews.text: My main gripe is that it took 1 month to receive this chair and I could not cancel the order to get it from another vendor... anyway, now that I have it, it's nice. Comfortable, supportive, look good. I have noticed, like others have said, it tends to lean forward. I attribute this to the fact that there is a fair amount of play in the structure of the chair. It feels secure, but does move around a bit more than I would like. Easy assembly, decent instructions and nuts, bolts, and Allen wrench included. Currently, I'm very satisfied with the purchase. I will update the review as time goes on.
customer_reviews.author: Autobahnpolizei

customer_reviews.title: Not tall enough, and it sags over time...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. This chair comes to about 4 inches lower than anticipated when fully extended. That may have been my bad in measuring, but when you sit on it, it slowly drops another 2-4 inches over time and you have to keep pulling the lever to extend - I weigh 160, so I don't think it's me... I'm going to give this to someone else to use as a regular short chair and buy a good stand-up chair for myself...
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Design and Manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: The chair looks nice and was semi easy to assemble until I got to the back rest and realized that the attachment holes on the back rest did not match the holes on the back support piece that you had to attach it to. I could get three of the four holes to match up by putting a bit of torque on the backrest, but the fourth hole was about 1/2 the bold diameter off. There is no way to get a bolt through that last hole. Since these attachment points are hard fixed to the support and back rest, it must have been manufactured this way. Faulty design and manufacturing, and no quality control. I am returning the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Hydrad

customer_reviews.title: Should have been better.
customer_reviews.text: I received the chair and assembled it fairly easily. Only after some time stoning in the chair did I noticed that there back and seat were not aligned, the mounting holes didn't make a square alignment so the seat is slightly off access from the back. They're was also a small hole in the leather material on the lower side of the seat. I can't really tell how it got there. The adjustability is good. It's fairly comfortable and the arm rests are nice. I would like the for rest to be a little stronger. It works, it's a chair.
customer_reviews.author: Arrow

customer_reviews.title: High quality tall chair
customer_reviews.text: Solid chair for the price. I am 245lbs and feels solid for me, would put cut off around 280-300lbs. Great if you want to sit up, very comfortable, and folding arms make great if you want to sit close or practice guitar. Do not recommend for leaning back, feels like you will fall back and die.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kocurek

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: The chair went together in less than thirty minutes and I love it. I’m a woman who has been in a wheelchair for years and I used a rolling kitchen stool for cooking. I’m 80 now and have fallen from it two times so we knew I needed something more sturdy. It’s plenty tall and rolls easily, very comfortable to sit in. Cooking will be fun again now.
customer_reviews.author: Grammasami

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with the comfort of the chair
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with the comfort of the chair, I use it for 12-16 hours a day in my dental laboratory as my main bench chair. My only real complaint after about a month of use is that it very quickly developed a multitude of squeaks and groans with every single move of my arms or body from various points in the chair. Not a huge deal, but it is a small irritation if you like a quiet workspace. Still a great chair for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't sure at first...
customer_reviews.text: As I was unboxing the parts, it looked like the pieces were "more glitter than gold." But it was easy to install, instructions easy to follow. Now that I'm first using it, is is pretty comfortable. And, compared to the chair it replaced, the vertical range is very impressive, as is the foot rest being adjustable. Wide seat & flip arms are great features, too. If any issue pops up, I'll adjust my review, but for now, I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: M.J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair for an Adjustable/Stand-Up Desk
customer_reviews.text: The first chair that was sent to me had a broken lever. Amazon quickly replaced it! This chair works great with the height of my new adjustable/stand-up desk, when my legs need a break. The quality seems to be nice and I love the adjustable arms. My only qualm is with the stability of the foot rest – it tends to quickly loosen and move down after use. Overall, I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: NF

customer_reviews.title: Product damaged upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: First, there was rattling parts within the circular part, found pieces of metal within side of it. Second, upon constructing the chair, it was extremely creaky, like it had been used or just poorly constructed in the first place. Key takeaway is that my wife and I wasted too much time on this chair and Amazon only corrected the problem once they found out how difficult it is to return furniture. I would recommend Amazon rethink their return policy and policies when customers need to return faulty furniture. Not a good experience overall with the product and service of Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: All-access Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble but cheaply made!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple to put together, for sure. I just couldn’t get the seat onto the back support as the directions don’t really tell you how to hold it in order to get the screws in. Then I couldn’t get to to tighten all the way down, but I am girl. It’s super cheap looking compared to the photos. The wheels are plastic! Which is a huge turn off. For 200$ I wouldn’t buy it ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindness Matters

customer_reviews.title: Most Definitely Not for Weight Capacity Shown
customer_reviews.text: Although the company shows the weight capacity at 330lbs, this chair most certainly isn't for a person of that size. I'm not that heavy, but even at my weight (300), this chair quickly began to creak and pop, within about 2 weeks of use. It wobbles when extended to about 24", and makes a great deal of noise. I need a chair that is silent, as I am an audiobook narrator who uses the chair in my vocal booth. Do NOT purchase this chair if you require a solid piece of furniture, or if you're heavier than 200lbs. Other than that, the chair is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kessel

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 years, then vinyl  on armrest starting cracking.
customer_reviews.text: I like this chair. For two years, just great. BUT the vinyl is now cracking. Customer support was responsive but, after 1 year, no warranty. And, they stock no spare parts, and could only suggest i buy a whole new chair. Oh my. So, if you are happy with 2 years use for the price then sending the whole thing to a landfill, go ahead (in today's age, with the need to be sustainable, how is that still an option?). Personally, I plan to either glue leather pads over the upper surface (may later peel away), or find a way to cover with a stretchy gray fabric. This manufacturer needs to stock parts for a chair that costs $160+
customer_reviews.author: W. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: No part replacement
customer_reviews.text: I loved the chair for the most part. However, when the arm pad wore too thin, I tried to obtain a replacement part from Modway but was informed that they would not sell me a part. It could ONLY be replaced under warranty (mine is past the one year warranty period). Now, instead of replacing a $10 part I'll need to replace a $175 chair. That's just silly. They could sell the part.
customer_reviews.author: JeffTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for high computer desk
customer_reviews.text: I have an adjustable computer desk in the office where I can stand or sit at work. This chair is high enough to let me sit up high and stand up easily when needed. Overall Quality: A great chair for the price, durable and solid. Leather: Smooth leather, nice feeling. Seat Cushion: Firm cushion, provides enough supports. Mesh Back Support: Great back support and yet still comfortable when leaning back.
customer_reviews.author: minnie

customer_reviews.title: Hey big guys, just get it!
customer_reviews.text: I wish there were more than like 1 review from a heavy big guy on here when i was researching. This chair is the bomb. had it now for a few months and its more comfortable and stable than I had imagined any drafting/stool could be. Don't worry about stability or comfort with this thing. It really is a bigger chair for bigger folks. Im 6' 2" and 270. Don't even worry about the modway attainment that compares pretty closely to this one. Just get the Edge.
customer_reviews.author: Telesonic

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how i feel about it!
customer_reviews.text: So, the husband likes his. but I am conflicted. The arms and height adjustment are perfect, but damn does the seat get hard. I can't get the angle of the seat to adjust(even though it is supposed to). By the time I have sat in this chair for 2 hours my backside is sore, not what you want in an office chair! Thinking about returning it, haven't made up my mind yet.
customer_reviews.author: Onlythebest

customer_reviews.title: Can't get a hold of them...
customer_reviews.text: I actually love this chair, but it keeps sliding down and won't stay up. I've tried to research how to contact the company and I can't find any seller information. That right there is TERRIBLE customer service. Learned my lesson the hard way! So I'm going to find a new chair to purchase and I will. make sure it's with a company that makes it easy to contact them if extra parts or help is needed. What a shame!
customer_reviews.author: Sonja

customer_reviews.title: Great for working at a drafting table all day.
customer_reviews.text: Being tall (6'), I have a hard time finding office furniture that fits me properly. This is a wonderful chair... very good if you are big, tall, plus sized or pregnant... and I am sure it is great for all other people as well. The seat is deep enough to support my long legs, the chair raises to a great height for the legs, the arch support fits perfectly and there is a nice "bounce" in the chair; it isn't as rigid feeling as some office chairs. The first chair I received had some damage, but, there was no issue with the exchange for a new chair. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good office chair for a desk that is higher up.
customer_reviews.text: I have a high desk so I need a chair with a high lift and this fits the bill. Very comfortable, sturdy and well designed. I really like that the Armrests can go up and down. Once this one gets used out I would buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's intended to, but cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Essentially, you are getting what you've paid for - the price point on this drafting chair is low when considering the average price of similar office furniture. The molded frame for the backrest came out of the package with damage that looks like it occurred during the manufacturing process; with depressions in the frame that look like scuffs or abrasions. The aluminum foot rest feels cheap and I am afraid to place too much pressure on it with my feet while mounting or dismounting. Overall I do like this drafting stool and for the low cost in comparison to higher quality comparisons it is still a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Viengkham

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair! Instructions should be a bit better for people
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice and sturdy chair. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because it seem to have only half the instructions with it. I mean, I figured things out on my own, but the part that was missing was a bit critical (attaching the seat to bottom part of the chair). Also, since it is so heavy at 45lbs (which is a plus not a knock) I didn't take that in regard because I needed it to go upstairs. I just took it a piece at a time upstairs and assembled it. Glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Fiene

customer_reviews.title: Had High hopes
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this chair, but sadly I am very disappointed. It was easy to assemble and everything about this seat is great, except for the seat cushion. I purchased the chair for working at home so I was using it many hours a day but I would of hoped that the seat cushion could of lasted longer then 6 weeks...
customer_reviews.author: Jem

customer_reviews.title: Best ! My 2nd !!!
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best chair money can buy specially for a big guy and I’m 63 260 and this chair is awesome the picture of the first one Is my original one it lasted five years 12 hours a day. I made a lot of money sitting in that chair , lol. It still works ! Bent in every way , wheels shot cylinder leaking, foam completely crushed flat. My new one feels like heaven.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Leaky piston, lasted 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it on May 26, 2018. I use this chair some 40 to 60 hours a week. I weight 190 pounds. Two years later, the piston is collapsing, so when you sit you start going down little by little until you the piston retracts all the way down. Not usable anymore, I guess is a throwaway. One of the arms vinyl broke and it is a bit scratchy.
customer_reviews.author: Jose C Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Second time buying this chair.
customer_reviews.text: Love the chair. It's been my work chair and gaming chair for 3 - 4 years. I used it so much the vinyl started rubbing off so I had to get a new chair. The wheels are pretty garbage so I'd suggest ordering wheels separately. Should probably come with nicer wheels instead of the plastic garbage based on price.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality @ a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Arrived timely. Pretty easy to put together. I did it myself and I'm not the usual 'assembler' when we have things that need to be built so that says a lot. It's comfy and I'm liking it so far. The seat is a little 'sticky' so that if you're higher up and have to jump down off it, you don't slide off. It requires more of a little jump. But I really love that the arms can be moved so you don't hit your desk if you spin around or if you just don't want arms at all. That was a cool feature I didn't expect.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: non impressive at all
customer_reviews.text: Forget about sitting in this chair for a long time. The cushion is not breathable, the front edge of the cushion is curving up and cutting into your hamstrings completely cutting off your circulation which is especially difficult when the chair is in the high position and your legs sometimes dangle. The mesh in the backrest is made of a soft material that stretches with time and your back actually leans against the plastic framing of the backrest. The chair feels sturdy and has a solid and strong feel to it.
customer_reviews.author: gordon k

customer_reviews.title: WRONG HARDWARE, BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: The chair came with the wrong size hardware for installing the seat. Instructions say M8x35 and the package of hardware has M6x35. I had to take a long drive to the hardware store and purchase the appropriate size M8x35 hardware which they only had in grade 8 so it cost me over $13.00 plus my time and gas. Very disappointed as it is a nice chair, but to not include the proper sized hardware?
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Kasper

customer_reviews.title: This chair is horrific to put together. I did ...
customer_reviews.text: This chair is horrific to put together. I did it by myself, but could have used a second person. Its just awkward to handle. The bottom ring absolutely will not stay where I put it. It continuously falls down. The description leads you to believe the arms are much more maneuverable than they actually are. They swing back, that's it. No height or width adjustments at all. If you are a heavier person, just keep in mind the arms do not go out to accommodate. You can lift them up and out of your way, but wouldn't be able to use them then.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: it extends up high
customer_reviews.text: I've had the chair since last Feb (2019) and I"m happy with it. Granted, one wheel has one side pulled loose, we have terrazzo tile and wide grout lines, I'm sure that is why that one came loose. I'm 235 and it works for me 4-6 hour a day on different adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Travis G King

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable chair
customer_reviews.text: I got this chair for my gf.. For her Drafting table.. She assembled it herself.. The instructions were easy, it also brought an allen key and extra screws, etc.. The only thing besides it being comfy.. It had a minor defect .. Just a slight indentation towards the foot. That shouldnt affect the chair.. We'd would get this chair again though. and definitely recommend it. The back slightly leans back with pressure and the footrest is a plus...
customer_reviews.author: John Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I got this chair for working from home. My back had been hurting from sitting at the table working on the computer, so we did some research to find an office chair that would be good for a short person. My husband put it together easily. It is a very comfortable chair! I like it a lot. My back has felt so much better as there is a lot support for your lower back. I also like the foot ring to rest my feet on. Our table is a pub style table so this is why I wanted to get a drafting chair. I am very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Office ~ Drafting Stool
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery and only 5 main products with all the tools needed to put together. Needed one person to help hold the back of chair to attach but my 87 yo father did that fine. LOVE the color it's painted in Architectural Gray so I didn't want black or any neutral beige. Perfect ~ thrilled to be working from home ~ 20 feet from their door. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: sallie Opicka

customer_reviews.title: Quality and great price
customer_reviews.text: feels sturdy, well built product! one of very few chairs that had everything I wanted. I needed a chair that I could use in multiple ways. I play guitar in this chair so the flip up arms and foot ring are a must. It lowers to the height of a regular desk chair and I can raise it for my drafting table too! It is moderatly comfortable as a desk chair but that could be just because I'm not fully used to it yet. Great chair for the price!
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this chair. For almost two years it kept my rear end and back cozy and comfortable at work. It squeaked a little but it was awesome for a tall drafting chair ... and then it wasn't. One of the wheels broke the post housing on the base and it wouldn't stay in so I emailed Modway's customer service and I all I got back was a "sorry for the inconvenience but we can't help." No replacement parts, no offers for discounts, just empathy. $165.00 chair should last longer than 23 months. Join me in boycotting Modway so Amazon won't sell their products.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Medical School Approved
customer_reviews.text: Great, comfortable chair. I study at home for 8+ hours a day as a medical student and this chair is comfortable while still providing great support. The movable arms are convenient and I love the option to lean back. It's constructed with great quality material and the chair is very stable. Assembly was simple and it has a bit of heft to it which I like as it doesn't feel flimsy. I've been using it now for 8+ months and have no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable & Perfectly adjusts to the height I need with arm rests that fold back out of the way.
customer_reviews.text: I love this chair! After renovating my craft room I needed a bar-height chair for my counter top workstations. It was easy to assemble myself without the help of my husband. The bottom foot-ring is height adjustable too. I love the fact that the arms fold up and back and out of the way, which makes it perfect when I need to be closer to my station. The seat is comfy and the back is also adjustable forward & back. This chair is perfect for me and my needs!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive quality at this price point.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this thing is sturdy. And comfortable, too. Easy enough to assemble. The directions said two people were required for the assembly, but if you're nimble and determined you can fly solo here. The chair adjusts smoothly in height, and the way the arm rests swing up and out of the way is an added bonus. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: shshopper

customer_reviews.title: A chair unlike any others
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this chair for several months now. It’s great. It is the only chair that I was able to find on the market that lowers to the height of a normal office chair and raises to the highest height of a drafting chair. Sturdy, although after a few months of use, I hear noises (rubbing of the screw and metal) while moving. This easily could be do to an assembly error on my part. All in all, I’d purchase again and recommend to all.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality; piston collapses
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, unfortunately. I'm very tall (but thin) and I was looking for some drafting stool with a seat as high as 28". This looked like it: the seat reaches 31". The downside is that the piston collapses as soon as you sit so you lose few inches immediatly after sitting. I wasn't expecting a lot from this given the price but there's no back setting and if you have some kind of back pain this might not help you. It's complicated to return so I'll just keep it for some time but I have the feeling this thing will soon appreciate the view from my dumpster.
customer_reviews.author: Michelangelo

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair but cylinder is not operational
customer_reviews.text: I really like this chair but the darn lift cylinder doesn't work. How in the world am I gonna get this fixed. We tried to take the seat off the cylinder and it won't come off. Not sure what to do now. I'll rate support after I get through to the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feel apart after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Not a very durable chair and the seat cushion is barely cushioned. Foot rest never stays in place. A bit pricey for what you get overall. This should be an $80 chair at best.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: very uncomfortable back
customer_reviews.text: I chose this chair because of all high reviews but back support is terrible. I got neck pain after couple of hours sitting on the chair. there is only 2-3 inches of contact between the chair and your back when you sit straight.
customer_reviews.author: Mahsa Ne

customer_reviews.title: Remove the Aluminum Modway plate from the back!!! It CUTS - OUCH
customer_reviews.text: My biggest concern when buying this chair was the height - I forgot to think about how far the chair will go down when you sit on it. My chair only goes up to 28.5", and as I weigh around 200lbs it goes down about 2" when I sit on it. So it is about 2" lower than I hoped it would be. Also, on the top back of the chair there is a small aluminium plate stuck on with cheap double sided tape, with the name Modway printed on it. I STRONGLY suggest removing this!! The cut that is bleeding on my left hand right now made me realise this!! OUCH
customer_reviews.author: Liam Clarke

customer_reviews.title: For the shortys
customer_reviews.text: Im 5'3" and have fat thighs. This was perfect for my standing desk when I needed to be a bit taller!! It also is small enough to be rolled away when I want to stand and I wasnt tripping all over it. Great chair. HIGHLY recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie

customer_reviews.title: Spring weld sheared ~14 months
customer_reviews.text: First the foot rest clamp kept slipping, but I ignored that. Second the backrest tension spring was weak so I leaned back too far. Third the backrest spring assembly weld, to the seat bottom, sheared; turning the chair into a stool. If it lasted two years I'd accept the quality but 14 months after an imperfect start puts the manufacturer on my no list. Might have gone with 2.5, but not an option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chair!
customer_reviews.text: I am 135 pounds and 5'3". This chair is most perfect fit I've ever had. This chair is awesome. When I get tired I can put my feet up (Indian style) and even lean back. I use it at a sit/stand desk and could not be more pleased. The pneumatic level does not work as well as I'd like, but I just leave it at one height. I tend to have back problems and this is very comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: If you’re over 200 lbs. read this!
customer_reviews.text: Chair came perfect. No scratches no dings. Took 30 minutes total to assemble. All the talk about problems perhaps came from the people not the chair. Now that being said here’s the one problem that arises not in the chair but the weight that’s applied to the chair. Your on a pole in the air. Shifting the chair around will cause the pole to lean forward or back as you move. Especially on carpet. So keep the chair lower to reduce the chance. Otherwise it will cause the base to wear quickly. Otherwise great product!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen green

customer_reviews.title: Good chair for the money
customer_reviews.text: This chair is a good alternative to expensive ergonomic chairs. The only thing I would caution is that this chair was made to sit high. It does say tall office chair in the description, but when googling chairs for short people, this chair pulls up. We had to end up giving it to another person in our office.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are a great buy. For those that have desk risers, but need to also sit, they lower to desk height. Some chairs don't lower as far as these do. We ordered several of these chairs for our office and when they arrived, two of the seats were damaged - appeared to be that way from the factory since it was clear the package was not damaged in shipping. Their team was very efficient and quick to help get the seats replaced. Very easy claims process. Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable people think clearer!
customer_reviews.text: OMG, I love my Chair!!! Good price, I put it together myself. I feel like an executive Queen in my house! Comfortable, I can make it short and I can make it tall, I love the range and you can fold the arms alll the way back (when I play my keyboard). You can use or not use the foot rack if the chair is low. LOVE, LoVe, love this chair!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After 9 months won't stay raised
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Modway Edge Drafting Chair 12.4.2019. I started having issues with the chair after 9-months, it will not stay raised all the time. When I sit in the chair it jolts down about an inch, then again and again til I am forced to stand. It's very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Below average drafting chair
customer_reviews.text: Sum it up, this chair sucks. I'm average height, the chair is not tall enough to work comfortably at a stand up desk. The foot ring is far from big enough, you need put your feet in to even use it and its constantly slipping down no matter how much I tighten it. The seat does not have enough padding, not very comfortable. I gave two stars because it looks good and was easy to put together. I've worked at a desk for 2 decades, I've had many very nice chairs, this is not one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wish the vendor has tighter quality control.
customer_reviews.text: The product is defective, with bent seat frame and leather punctured. this item is returned. One more thing, these wheels should have brakes on them.
customer_reviews.author: SHooter 69

customer_reviews.title: Well put together chair for work
customer_reviews.text: This chair is pretty sturdy. I have had it for a couple of months and no issues. I use it for my home office so it’s pretty comfortable. No complaints at this time. So far great chair!
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Check the height
customer_reviews.text: So.. make sure you check the height.. i did not. The pedestal was shorter than I expected. I used the old pedestal from the chiar I replaced. Other the my personal error.. this chair is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: The Drafting Stool that Got a Great Review!
customer_reviews.text: So far I Love the drafting stool! I received it earlier than expected and put it together in 30 minutes, rolled it right up to my 39"inch tall desk and got to work! Easy to put together and for the money its a Great buy in my opinion. Very comfortable seat, and the back support is perfect where I need it. For the lower back lumbar support I find the straighter I sit in the chair the better support my lower back gets. Right on Target LexMod, Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Sarvis

customer_reviews.title: Cost exceeds the quality of this chair.
customer_reviews.text: The chair is attractive but after ten minutes in it the seat get concrete hard. It appears to be a good cushion but only for a few minutes. It also feels as if you are leaning forward in the seat and might slide out. Also the padding on the arms are not sufficient. It is very jerky when lowering it. I’m very disappointed in the chair and feel the cost exceeds the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rozita Martin

customer_reviews.title: Rises to bar height
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair because I wanted a chair that rises up high to bar height and low to normal desk height. I love this chair, so I bought another one. Looks great, comfy, arms flip up if you want them out of the way. Great for desks that raise and lower.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Hutson

customer_reviews.title: My favorite chair
customer_reviews.text: This chair is great. I'm fairly tall and love being able to set up high or low and comfy. The flip up arms are great if you play music. I've had it for a few years and have used it everyday. When I need to buy another, it will be this chair again.
customer_reviews.author: Hokum

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair!
customer_reviews.text: Nice chair. Comfortable, and seems well built. I love how the arms move up out of the way so I can easily get out of the chair from the side if necessary. I would have given it 5 stars but it did arrive slightly damaged. It had a small tear in one of the arms. Not big enough to go through the hassle of requesting a return.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite purchases this year! The chair is very sturdy and can be used as either an office chair or a drafting stool. At either height, the comfort is the same. Easy to assemble and arrived quickly. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: FREQNTAMZNBUYR77

customer_reviews.title: It's just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair because I have a desk that's a bit higher than normal - most standard office chairs were too low and had me reaching up to reach my keyboard, which was bad for my arms and shoulders. I use this chair in the lowest position (21 inches) and it works perfectly. The seat and armrests are padded nicely and are comfortable. I've had it for a couple of months and it's holding up well, too. I'm very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for a big guy and good total height option.
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for my awful office chair. I'm a big guy and this is a very comfortable chair. I like the way the arms lift out of the way and I can pull one or both down if I want to, also the height should work well with the stand-up desks we will be getting.
customer_reviews.author: GreyWolf

customer_reviews.title: Contortionist assembly
customer_reviews.text: You need a flashlight, some props, and at least three yoga positions to put this thing together. Parts don't match up easily without a lot of finagling. There was a crack in the base when I received it. I don't think it will be my downfall, but it does make me wonder about quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne A.

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for Standing desk
customer_reviews.text: A little bit short to reach standing desk, but we really like it. Wish it was real leather and not vinyl, we gladly pay more money for a leather version, setup took 10 min or less.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Great, but broken wheel.
customer_reviews.text: I like the chair. It's comfortable and was easy to assemble. My only disappointment was finding the top plate on one of the 5 wheels was broken off when I opened the package. I epoxied it, and am waiting for it to fully cure before I see if it will work. I hope so, because if not, the chair is not very useful with 4 wheels. If the wheel wasn't broken, I would have given an easy 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Will O.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Loved it. So pretty and comfortable, but it has been hardly used and the foot rest has given in already and its completely flimsy, let alone how noisy it has become in the one month of use (I was out of town for a month so I am just now starting to use it). I purchased this for my studio and one month in it's useless, as I need a completely quiet chair. Such a waste of my money. If the noise is not an issue for you, by all means get it, its pretty and comfortable, but for me it didn't work out at all.
customer_reviews.author: Nathalia

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, attractive sleek look
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for home office/craft table. Comfortable and love that the arms flip up to help tuck it close to the desk.
customer_reviews.author: KKane

customer_reviews.title: Height is perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Got it today! Assembly is simple and straight forward - took me less than 30min with the allen wrench provided. The foot ring is kinda small - wish it was a little bigger in diameter, Height is perfect for my needs. Comfort, I still have to determine that since I just got this chair today. I have to work and seat on it while working for a good week or 2 to determine its overall ergonomics. Overall, first impression the quality looks good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Tesla

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last two years.
customer_reviews.text: Just pass on this one. After almost two years the wheel base has broken. In my 30+ years of buying desk chairs I've never had the wheel base break. Spend a little more for quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: Chair is very comfy and feels rather solid. The leather isn't good for humid climates (if you live in one you should be aware of this) and the mental bar for your feet isn't nice to put your feet on if you are barefoot. Also the bar seems to move if you don't tighten it down enough, FYI. My only large complaint is that while assembling the chair the screw holes in the back don't line up perfectly. You have to tighten them at an angle, which is concerning but I haven't had an issue yet.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Brin

customer_reviews.title: Great chair with a few flaws in manufacture, but otherwise worth
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chair. Has good altitudinal adjustability and a comfy back. Two complaints: the arm rests are a bit low, I'm 6'1"; and the back support casting was cheap: I had to shave off some chips. Otherwise recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for standing desks!
customer_reviews.text: This chair looks very nice in my office, and was very easy to assemble. I've been using this chair for about four months and it has held up very well. I did have to tighten the screws on the bottom once, but I think it was due to me not tightening them enough when I initially assembled it. The only reason I purchased this chair was because I switched to a standing desk. It adjusts perfectly to my standing desk height and the foot rest is adjustable as well. The back support is very impressive, and the cushion is just the right firmness.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice comfy chair
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about the assembly, the guy who did it for us said it was easy. We really like the way the arms can go up, for the bigger person or for someone with a belt/gun kit on. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy G.

customer_reviews.title: I got screwed or not...
customer_reviews.text: Chair looks good, but I cannot tell you how comfortable it is. Why you ask, let me tell you. Upon receiving the chair you could tell that it was a return. Once the box was open, oops, there is no hardware to put it together. It's to much of a hassle to return the chair for a new one so I was able to buy hardware at a local store to put it together. Long story short, maybe the seller should have checked to make sure they received all of the parts back before they shipped to a new customer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke Down in a year
customer_reviews.text: After about a year some irreplaceable washers/spacer broke so the back of the chair wobbles and doesn't recline correctly. There's alot of play in the back seat
customer_reviews.author: JoMike Milly

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay  but needs to be sturdier.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to rate this chair is five stars, the height is good but the wheels are constantly traveling all over the floor, and the seat wobbles on the post. It is usable but it could’ve been manufactured better. I am not convinced that this product will last more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jones

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS PICTURED. I selected this drafting chair based ...
customer_reviews.text: NOT AS PICTURED. I selected this drafting chair based upon the design of the footrest but the design of what shipped is altogether different. Additionally the chrome footrest bar has holes in it as if they were made by accident. Attached is a photo of the footrest that ships with this chair and as you can see it is not nearly as structural as the one pictured in the listing. bummed...
customer_reviews.author: Ted Visner

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend for anyone that spends any significant amount of time ...
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and spend many hours each day sitting in this chair. I used to end my days with my back and hip hurting... Not anymore! I highly recommend for anyone that spends any significant amount of time sitting at a desk!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle C

customer_reviews.title: Fine So Far
customer_reviews.text: The box it arrived in defied belief and the packing inside wasn't much better. But all pieces were there, in perfect condition, and it assembled easily in about 15 minutes. No complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: So comfy
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality. You get what you pay for. It’s the coziest seat in the house now! The chair’s lowest level is still pretty high, so make sure (if this is for a desk), that you have a high enough table for it to go underneath. Measure!
customer_reviews.author: Honestly...

customer_reviews.title: Wish the seat cushion was thicker and/or firmer
customer_reviews.text: I wish the seat cushion was thicker and/or firmer. Everything else was satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Standing desk chair.
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase! Easy to put together. For a 5’11” 200lbs, this chair is sturdy with excellent lumbar support. Very comfortable seat cushion. The only thing I would have liked to have on the chair was adjustable arm rest height. The arms only pivot on the side from parallel to perpendicular. However, the chair itself is height adjustable and it can fit under most standing desks.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: the box was damaged
customer_reviews.text: 2 or 3 little scares on it. I was un happy chair fell out and the drive pick it back up. DAVE
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for a petite person
customer_reviews.text: do not buy this product- it is cheap and the company does not support it. THe hydrolic shock went out and the foot step bent. the arm rests are not positionable to comfort. They are either up or down and when down they are too low for you to rest on unless you slouch.
customer_reviews.author: h2oskijayn

customer_reviews.title: hard to unassemble for return--clyinder not coming off??
customer_reviews.text: I am sure the product is good but one of the base screws was at and angle and the whole screw would not go in and leaving it unstable. Tried to return item but unable to take cylinder out of the chair to but back in box.
customer_reviews.author: Anupam Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a drafting hight chair
customer_reviews.text: The chair is good and is suiting my needs nicely. I wish that the arm rests had some more adjustment options. The chair was packaged in a way that made it difficult to find all the pieces for assembly. Edit after 4 months of use: webbing on back of chair has started separating from the edges. Not holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: out of balance as it sits, covers cracked in 6 months, the ring collapsed almost immediately, and now final straw is the plastic that hold the wheels in crumbled, it's total junk, i must now get a much better chair, not good for 3 years with medium use.
customer_reviews.author: Hasble Jolbsby

customer_reviews.title: cheap components....already broken.
customer_reviews.text: Loved it, at first....its been 3 1/2 months and its already broken....will not stay up, and now its useless for the high desk it was purchased for... :(
customer_reviews.author: Beach Momma

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but need some better design at hinge for back support
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but have had for two years and the back support has broken and does not fully support like it use to.
customer_reviews.author: E. Rosen

customer_reviews.title: The chair is a lot more comfortable than I thought it would be and works perfectly ...
customer_reviews.text: It arrived quickly and went together in the same fashion. The chair is a lot more comfortable than I thought it would be and works perfectly for my standing desk. One arm lifts a little easier than the other and the foot rest wont' stay up for long with any weight on it, but I'm tall enough where if the ring is resting on the bottom it's at a perfect height.
customer_reviews.author: G.Hans

customer_reviews.title: Decent chair for the money
customer_reviews.text: Went together easy, quality is good. I have had this chair for couple of weeks now fairly comfortable, but one thing that would make this chair even better is a thicker seat cushion. I purchased many office chairs, and this one has been the one of the better ones, and it was not the most expensive one either. I would buy this chair again.
customer_reviews.author: John Mazzie

product_meta.title: Modway Edge Drafting Chair - Reception Desk Chair - Flip-Up Arm Drafting Chair in Gray
product_meta.description: Color:GrayWelcome to a new era in functional comfort. The Edge Tall Drafting Chair implements cutting edge ergonomics to deliver a comprehensive seating experience. Edge Standing Desk or Drafting Chair features a breathable mesh back for lower back lumbar support, padded waterfall vinyl seat to ease pain and pressure around your thighs, flip-up padded arms, an extra tall gas cylinder with a footring, and it securely locks in place with a user-friendly seat tilt plus tension control knob. Edge is a progressively minded drafting stool perfect for school, work, or home use.
feature_bullets: STUDIO CHAIR - Practice your guitar, architecture drafting, painting or sewing with a tall chair that pairs nicely with drafting tables. Attainment has flip-up arms that make it easy to practice.
RECEPTION DESK CHAIR - Greet guests while comfortably seated in a drafting stool. This counter height high office chair has a hydraulic seat adjustment range of 20.5” - 29" from the ground.
STANDING DESK COMPANION - The Edge Drafting Stool is the adjustable office chair of choice if you stand at work but also appreciate being able to sit down from time to time.
ERGONOMIC - Edge comes with lower back lumbar support, a padded waterfall mesh seat to keep your back and thighs posture perfect, full 360 degree swivel, and seat tilt plus tension control knob.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars523 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
specifications.Warranty Description: One year warranty against manufacturer defects.
